Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the tax on Christmas trees by stating that fees will be passed on to consumers. The expert's verdict clarifies that it is unclear whether the fee would be passed on to consumers.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the tax on Christmas trees was created by Obama, while the expert's verdict explains that the idea for the tree assessment had been in discussion for many years before Obama's presidency.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to confirm that Obama created a new tax on Christmas trees. The expert's verdict provides more context and explains the true nature of the tree assessment.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the tree assessment, such as the fact that it was sought by a national fresh tree group to promote their products. The expert's verdict provides this alternative explanation.
